title: Rain enhancement technologies investor Paul Dacier buys $100k in stock
author: Investing.com
excerpt: Rain enhancement technologies investor Paul Dacier buys $100k in stock
text: Paul T. Dacier, a significant shareholder of Rain Enhancement Technologies Holdco, Inc. (NASDAQ:RAIN), has acquired 8,782 shares of the company's Class A common stock. The shares were purchased at approximately $11.39 each, totaling around $100,026. The micro-cap company, currently valued at $3.97 million, has seen its stock surge over 430% in the past year. According to InvestingPro analysis, the stock appears overvalued at current levels, with a Fair Financial Health Score of 2.27. This transaction was completed as part of a private placement linked to a business combination involving Coliseum Acquisition Corp. and Rain Enhancement Technologies, Inc. Following this acquisition, Dacier holds a total of 1,848,104 shares indirectly through Rainwater LLC. Want deeper insights into RAIN's valuation and insider trading patterns? InvestingPro subscribers get access to exclusive financial metrics and real-time alerts on insider transactions. This article was generated with the support of AI and reviewed by an editor. html:
Paul T. Dacier, a significant shareholder of Rain Enhancement Technologies Holdco, Inc. (NASDAQ:RAIN), has acquired 8,782 shares of the company's Class A common stock. The shares were purchased at approximately $11.39 each, totaling around $100,026. The micro-cap company, currently valued at $3.97 million, has seen its stock surge over 430% in the past year. According to InvestingPro analysis, the stock appears overvalued at current levels, with a Fair Financial Health Score of 2.27. This transaction was completed as part of a private placement linked to a business combination involving Coliseum Acquisition Corp. and Rain Enhancement Technologies, Inc. Following this acquisition, Dacier holds a total of 1,848,104 shares indirectly through Rainwater LLC. Want deeper insights into RAIN's valuation and insider trading patterns?
